column1: harmonicacave 161077686032 "2017-05-26 01:45:35 GMT" https://harmonicacave.tumblr.com/post/161077686032/maritimegothic-i-think-a-big-thing-that "maritimegothic:  i think a big thing that disconcerts adults about learning new skills is that learning as an adult means you are very awareÂ of how bad you are at the beginning in a way children arenâ€™t. i picked up the saxophone when i was 11 and played until i was about 17. by the end of it i was first chair in our highest ensemble

column1: harmonicacave 159548740569 "2017-04-14 02:00:44 GMT" https://harmonicacave.tumblr.com/post/159548740569/if-it-doesnt-have-an-hea-or-hfn-its-not "thebibliosphere:  romancingthebookworm:  I know weâ€™ve seen this discussion pop up more than once (like the author of this piece points out
column2: it usually cycles through every few months) but this is probably one of my favorite set-downs of the Non-HEA crowd yet.Â  Itâ€™s well phrased
column3: fairly comprehensive
column4: and just slightly scathing.  Itâ€™s the utter bane of my existence when people send me their manuscripts to edit
column5: and I get a cover email that read along the lines of â€œIâ€™m not a fan of romance novels so I added my own twistâ€ and my soul curdles because first of all a) if you donâ€™t like romance but youâ€™re writing it because youâ€™ve realized itâ€™s lucrative and you think Anyone can do it because itâ€™s â€œeasyâ€: get the Hell out of my genre and b) suffering and misery instead of a happily ever after (or happy for now) are not twists. Itâ€™s not edgy
column7: in fact what it shows me is that you do not understand the genre on a fundamental level and shouldnâ€™t be writing for it. Romance is a fantasy genre
column8: people donâ€™t read fantasy for endless suffering (thank you GRRMartin et al for making every edgelord in the world think nitty gritty detail = pain and suffering without relief and flooding the genre with their shitty reimaginings of the characters from Lord of the Rings but set to the plot of SAW) they read fantasy to know that the suffering  will end. That evil will eventually be defeated
column9: that good things can and will still happen and that the sun will shine again. Romance is no different from that
column10: except it is a genre primarily considered to be feminine and therefore subject to ridicule and the belief that somehow if a woman can do it
column11: it must be easy â€œBut Joy
column12: â€ I hear some of you say
column13: â€œRomance doesnâ€™t have that reputation because of sexism
column14: itâ€™s because of how many bad writers get published in it and make it look bad.â€ *angry buzzer sound* oh Iâ€™m sorry that was incorrect
column15: you see every genre has an abundance of shitty books that make it to print
column16: whether itâ€™s goofball sci-fi or Lord of the â€œall my characters are white because of historical accuracyâ€ Rings 94949392.0 (or if you really want to start a fight
column17: every mediocre white man considered a classic by the literary genre and lauded by academia for writing about wanting to have an affair with one of his students/the inevitability of death) and while they are subject to criticism
column18: thereâ€™s still not quite the same vitriol that Romance gets for wanting
column20: a happy life. There is nothing wrong with feel good media
column21: there is nothing wrong with wanting to enjoy something a little bit silly and unapologetically happy. The popularity of coffee shop Aus in fandom is both unsurprising and nothing new. Itâ€™s quite literally common romance tropes that have been around forever but with the diversity of fandom (*eyes ao3 tag* kind of) and I will die on this hill defending the validity of Happily Ever Afters and Happily For Now before I let anyone try to take it from my icy cold grip. And if I get one more romance manuscript with a cover letter that says theyâ€™ve added a twist
column22: then god dam y'all someone had better have twisted their ankle and been carried bridal style to their bed because Iâ€™m so over people hating on the simple want for happiness.  THERE IS NOTHING WRONG WITH FEEL GOOD MEDIA." False link
